It will be necessary to bring a considerable quantity of sugar from the East, Java and Mauritius during June - Septemb#i as supplies in the West will not be sufficient for the Allies' requirements. This quantity is at present estimated a!t about 500,000 tons*

The probable share of the U.K. in these options is 200,000 tons, tb* In addition Maize options were held on 89,223 ton3. The probable share of the U.K. in these options is 50 000 tons.

(d) The f&ipping situation makes it improbable that any large proportion of this wheat will be shipped duKLng the war.
